Class SentimentLex

  • java.lang.Object
    • SentimentLex

  • public class SentimentLex
extends java.lang.Object
    SentimentLex object contains all informations from a given sentiment lexicon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description

      Constructs a new SentimentLex

    • Constructor Detail

      • SentimentLex

        public SentimentLex(boolean flexMWE)
        Constructs a new SentimentLex
        Parameters:
        flexMWE - indicates if the multi word expressions in the lexicon should be interpreted in a flexible way (more info see mweFlexibility(SentimentUnit)).

    • Method Detail

      • getSentiment

        public SentimentUnit getSentiment(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the SentimentUnit corresponding to the given name or null.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the sentiment to look for.
        Returns:
        SentimentUnit for a given name or null if no SentimentUnit with the given name exists

      • getAllSentiments

        public java.util.ArrayList<SentimentUnit> getAllSentiments(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the SentimentUnits (more than one if there is more than one lexicon entry) corresponding to the given name or null. Up to 50 entries possible for one sentiment.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the sentiment to look for.
        Returns:
        SentimentUnit for a given name or null if no SentimentUnit with the given name exists

      • addSentiment

        public void addSentiment(SentimentUnit sentiment)
        Adds a sentiment expression to the internal lexicon, possibly interpreting the with some flexibility (for MWEs).
        Parameters:
        sentiment - is added to SentimentLex

      • mweFlexibility

        public java.util.ArrayList<SentimentUnit> mweFlexibility(SentimentUnit sentiment)
        Returns an ArrayList of SenimentUnits that are the result of flexible interpretation of the given MWE SentimentUnit. Flexibility is applied w.r.t. the following words that are found in the MWE: 1) Reflexive pronouns: sich --> sich, mich, dich, ihn, ... etc 2) Possessive pronouns: seinen --> seinen, meinen, deinen, ... etc 3) Ein(en)/Kein(en): ein(en) --> ein(en), kein(en) 4) Sein/Werden: sein --> sein, werden 5) Other: den --> den, einen, dem
        Parameters:
        sentiment - given a MWE SentimentUnit
        Returns:
        ArrayList of SentimentUnits that are created by flexibility

      • removeSentiment

        public void removeSentiment(SentimentUnit sentiment)
        Parameters:
        sentiment - is removed from SentimentLex
